author: Joey Tuong

changelog.release_notes:
/!\ Help needed! I've got a lot of requests for pebble classic and pebble time round versions, but I don't have the time. If anyone has any pebble.js skills, consider contributing to https://github.com/tetrapus/PoGoPebble

/!\ This is the watchface version of the app. For the watchapp with more interactivity, see https://apps.getpebble.com/en_US/application/5798e5b11482cdda2b0000c8

What's new:
- Night mode (Enable Backlight) in the settings menu enables the backlight when you lock onto a Pokemon. Best for night time pokemon hunting!
- Add a new setting to temporarily disable priority settings, for when you just want to catch 'em all.

Fixes:
- Vibrate when the active pokemon enters the alert range, not just on first appearance
- Fix search bar so it isn't terrible
- Fix undefined settings before first config

Optimisations:
- Optimised more pokemon sprites

This release includes an improved search interface, and the ability to lock the active pokemon.

Shake your watch to lock a pokemon, and shake again to release.

For full navigational features, check out the watchapp version of this release, which includes scrolling through pokemon, dismissing pokemon, and changing pokemon priority, available at https://apps.getpebble.com/en_US/application/5798e5b11482cdda2b0000c8

I'll be maintaining both versions, so feel free to decide which way you like to use it better. A battery saving mode and better alert presets is coming in a future version to make it more suitable for every-day use. I don't recommend installing both...

P.S PokeVision is currently down, make sure it's up before you report a bug with this release :)

First release!

See https://github.com/tetrapus/PoGoPebble for documentation.

Don't forget to set your team in the watchface settings!

description:
Hunt nearby Pokemon and show off your team colours!

Check out the settings page to set your team and customise alerts.

PokeWatch will vibrate when a new pokemon appears and show nearby pokemon. Shake your wrist to lock in the active pokemon and display it's location.

NOTE: If your watch does not show any pokemon, the pokemon go servers may be down, you may have no pokemon in your area or your GPS location could not be determined.

The compass is relative to north. For the best experience, align your Pokemon Go map to north and track down those Pokemon!
title: PokeWatch
